comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content:
Wait a minute...

"[Portrait of Alan Kent and Austin Croom-Johnson, New York, N.Y., between 1946 and 1948] (LOC)":
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5354796026/]

"[Portrait of Billy Kyle, New York, N.Y.(?), between 1938 and 1948] (LOC)":
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5354796148/]

These are clearly the same photo, or nearly the same photo after light retouching.

Presumably the latter has the wrong caption? That one only mentions one person, not two.

comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content: According to Wikipedia, this is Billy Kyle. That would seem to confirm that the Billy Kyle one is correct, and the Alan Kent and Austin Croom-Johnson one is mislabelled, &/or the wrong photo.

comment.author: 92229690@N00
comment._content: Also mistaken in the label is the implication that the photographer Gottlieb is still alive. His years should be 1917-2006.  Hey if the Library of Congress needs to hire an archivist, please email me, because i have friends who'd love to do that!
